title: A typographic connection to Dorchester, UK?
content: I hoping for a little assistance in making a typographic connection to the town/area of Dorchester in Dorset, UK.
author: James Corazzo

comments.content:
Hi James,

there’s always [Dorchester Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015180436/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/dorchester-script/)  
(Okay, that was an easy one).  
F

yola,

I believe a fella called Alan Reynolds Stone is from Dorset...or maybe he was just buried there.  
He was an engraver and such...but he also did some typography, I think a face called Minerva is his.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reynolds\_Stone](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015180436/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reynolds_Stone "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reynolds\_Stone")

It's a stretch, but there you go!

v.good Florian, I probably deserved that!

Impressive connection Leigh, you were right called Minerva, lived and buried in Dorset.  
Many thanks for that.

Reynolds Stone did a number of woodcuts showing people reading.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015180436im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Five_6307.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015180436im_/http:/typophile.com/files/four_5617.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015180436im_/http:/typophile.com/files/three_6712.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015180436im_/http:/typophile.com/files/two_5952.jpg)
  
He certainly loved the Dorset countryside.
Yes what attention to the details, and a reader for every generation.
Those woodcuts are great. Love that second one.
